intro: Alsine platensis, commonly known as the broadleaf alsike, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other economically important plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are broad and oval-shaped, with a distinctive bluish-green color. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring.
